intro: Chamaesyce elegans, commonly known as the elegant sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its drought tolerance and ability to spread rapidly, it is often considered a weed in disturbed areas.
